title: Unification of behavior and API of `create_sibling*`
body:
Originally posted to https://github.com/datalad/datalad/pull/3447

`create_sibling_gitlab` essentially runs without any arguments and still does its job, given that it can find (or is pointed to) the required configuration in a superdataset that represent the origin or seed point of a dataset collection/hierarchy. This could be a model that could be applied to other `create_sibling*` commands too. If we do that, we finally have a straightforward path to replacing `create_sibling()` with an actual wrapper command that can call the appropriate actual implementation for a given target (thx to @bpoldrack for pointing this out). We could then (finally) revert the rename of `create_sibling_sshwebserver`. The common API would then be:

```
create-sibling-... -d <dswithconfig> -s NAME -r -R <int> --publish-depend <label> [PATH [PATH ...]]
```

where `PATH` is a directory with (a) specific dataset(s) to create a sibling for. Any other option not listed above is considered implementation specific, and a command must come with the ability to read its value from a configuration, if not given.
